title: Eden Hazard admits he wanted to leave Chelsea for Real Madrid one year earlier
text:
Eden Hazard has revealed that he had already decided to leave Chelsea a year before he departed Stamford Bridge this summer.

After helping the Blues win the Europa League in May, the influential playmaker made a £150million switch to the Bernabeu just a few days later.

But the move had been on the cards as early as the 2018 World Cup and he admitted he had also been convinced by Madrid and former Chelsea team-mate Thibaut Courtois about ending his stay in west London.

Eden Hazard made the move to Real Madrid from Chelsea in the summer for £150million

Madrid president Florentino Perez and Luka Modric were also influential in his exit from Stamford Bridge, where he arrived from Lille in 2012 and proved key in landing two Premier League titles, two Europa Leagues, the FA Cup and the League Cup.

'Courtois is someone I know well and trust,' he told Real Madrid TV. 'He always told me it [Madrid] was the best club.

'After the World Cup in Russia I wanted to go to Madrid, I had already made the decision.

Hazard admits Madrid, Belgium and former Chelsea team-mate Thibaut Courtois helped influence his move to the Bernabeu. Pictured they celebrate a win with their national side

'It was not possible and I had to spend another year at Chelsea. That made the exit easier though, Chelsea understood and let me out.

'I spoke to Florentino [Perez] and he told me that he wanted to sign me.

'After, I spoke with Luka Modric and felt that everyone wanted me at Real Madrid. And finally it was fulfilled.'

Despite finally getting his move to Madrid it has not been an ideal start for the 28-year-old in the Spanish capital.

He has just one goal and two assists across all competitions in seven appearances, with Madrid yet to hit their full stride in La Liga and the Champions League.
